page.title: 07Langtoft Grange Farm 3
page.content: The 21 acre field will however be ready first. In December mum and dad go away for 2 days and Stan and Les look after the farm. At the end of December the snow usually begins to fall and we have to build shelters for the sheep. The corn is still going from the sheds and some of the big lorries get stuck up our road. At the end of February the sheep begin to lamb and we have to get the sheds set up. Dad has to get up in the middle of the night to see if any of the sheep have lambed. I get up at half-past 6 but mum gets up at half-past 4. When the lambing is finished it will be about 3 weeks before we start clipping. It is only a days work for our contractor. If it is hot in the next 2 weeks we have to dip the sheep for flies.
